McCord Families!
We’d love for you to join us in welcoming our new Superintendent/Principal, Mr. Les Potter!
Mr. Potter comes to us from the Alva school district, but lives in Pawhuska and has worked there as a teacher/coach and administrator, he has also taught in Claremore. He and his wife Leslie have two grown children and five adorable grandchildren that they think are pretty great!
So far we have learned that he has numerous years in education and loves kids, he’s a hard worker, loves to cook, has a fun you tube channel for the modern day homesteaders, has fun with family and friends at the lake, is an OSU alum (Go Pokes), and is a pretty funny guy!
Take a minute and introduce yourself and your kiddos, and make Mr. Potter feel welcome!
He’s going to love his new McCord family!

Preliminary state scores are available for parents and each student to view. These scores are posted on the Student/Family Portal linked on the new online interactive Oklahoma School Report Card dashboard at oklaschools.com. While on the portal, families can also compare their child’s test results from previous years. To access the portal, click on the “Your Student” tab.

To log in, families must have their student’s unique 10-digit State Testing Number, or STN, which is available through the McCord School Parent Portal or on previous OSTP paper parent reports. Families are limited to one account but can share a password once that account has been activated. The portal is accessible in English or Spanish.

If you are not able to access the Parent Portal on our website, you may contact Ms. Wasson or come into our temporary office to obtain the STN.
